    • showTable

      @RequestMapping("deleteUser") public java.lang.String showTable​(@RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String user_id_hidden, java.lang.String actionBtnValue) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.io.IOException
      To Delete the User
      Parameters:
      user_id_hidden - get the user_id which must be deleted
      actionBtnValue - Check if the OK button clicked by the alert dialog
      Returns:
      to Manager Page - Manage User Section
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.io.IOException

    • addUser

      @RequestMapping("AddUser") public java.lang.String addUser​(@RequestParam(required=true) java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String birthday, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String motherLanguage, java.lang.String residencePermit, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String number, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String post_code, java.lang.String high_school, java.lang.String university, java.lang.String integration_course, java.lang.String dsh_course, java.lang.String german_level, java.lang.String roleType) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Respone about adding new User with all roles
      Parameters:
      firstName - the firstname of the new user
      lastName - the lastname of the new user
      birthday - the birthday of the new uuser
      gender - the gender of the new user
      email - the email of the new user
      userName - the username of the new user
      password - the password of the new user
      country - the country of the new user
      motherLanguage - the mother language of the new user
      residencePermit - the residence permit type of the new user
      street - the home_street of the new user
      number - the house number of the new user
      city - the cuty of the new user
      post_code - the post code of the new user
      high_school - if the new user has high school
      university - if he study in the university
      integration_course - if he has integration course certificate
      dsh_course - if he has DSH certificate
      german_level - what is his German level
      roleType - if the new user Manager, Worker, Customer or volunteer
      Returns:
      Manager Page, Manage User Section
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • uploadFile

      @RequestMapping(value="uploadDocument", method=POST) public java.lang.String uploadFile​(@RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String name, java.lang.String language, java.lang.String Type, java.lang.String document_for_user, org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile browse) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      response to upload the file onto server side
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the uploaded file
      language - language the name of the uploaded file
      Type - Type of the Document (Public OR Private)
      document_for_user - the id of the user which the document belongs to
      browse - the uploaded file object
      Returns:
      to Manager page, Manage Document section
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.lang.IllegalStateException
      java.io.IOException

    • createEvent

      @RequestMapping("createEvent") public java.lang.String createEvent​(@RequestParam(required=true) java.lang.String privacy, java.lang.String forUser, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String endTime, java.lang.String location) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.io.IOException, java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Response about creating Event
      Parameters:
      privacy - The Privacy of the event (Public or for special User)
      forUser - the ID of the User if the event was Privacy
      title - the name of the event
      date - the date of the event
      startTime - the start time of the event
      endTime - the end time of the event
      location - the location of the vent
      Returns:
      to Manager Page, Calendar Section
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.io.IOException
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException

    • editEvent

      @RequestMapping("editEvent") public java.lang.String editEvent​(@RequestParam(required=true) java.lang.String event_id, java.lang.String privacy, java.lang.String for_user, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String endTime, java.lang.String location) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.io.IOException, java.security.GeneralSecurityException
      Response about edit the already created event
      Parameters:
      event_id - the event_id which must be edited
      privacy - if the event has to be Public or private
      for_user - if private for which user
      title - the name of the new event
      date - the date of the new Event
      startTime - the start Time of the new Event
      endTime - The end tome of the new Event
      location - The location of the new Event
      Returns:
      to Manager Page, Manage Event Section
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.io.IOException
      java.security.GeneralSecurityException
